alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:59AM MDT until April 22 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Redfield affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Redfield. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge at the gauging location At 23.0 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles east of the gauge At 24.0 feet, Water goes over the top of the bridge at the gauging location the highway between Mellette and Brentford floods At 25.0 feet, The bridge 2 miles east of the gauge is overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 700 PM CDT.
